description: Unique identifier for the maintenance template used to generate work orders.
Workgroup or team responsible for executing work from this template.
Code classifying the work order; likely distinguishes scheduled versus other types; confirm with SME.
Default urgency level applied to work orders created from the template.
Number of days added to the computed target date when scheduling the work.
Default status used when the work order is active or underway.
Associated project identifier for budgeting, scheduling, or reporting.
Time-based interval for recurring service (e.g., number of days between occurrences).
Meter-based interval quantity for triggering service; confirm exact unit source.
Shift code indicating when the work should be performed or staffed.
Detailed description of the maintenance templateâ€™s scope and frequency.
Default technician, role, or team assigned to the work.
User who created the template record.
Date and time the template record was created.
User who last modified the template.
Date and time of the most recent modification.
Concise title used on work orders generated from the template.
Custom user-defined text field 1 for template-specific information.
Custom user-defined text field 2 for template-specific information.
Supervisor responsible for overseeing the work.
Crew leader assigned to direct the field crew.
Identifier of the parent template from which this template inherits settings.
Indicates whether the system auto-builds the description from rules instead of manual entry.
Soft-delete or inactive marker for the template; used to suppress use without removing history.
Accounting or cost center account to which charges will be posted.
Estimated labor cost for performing the work.
Estimated labor hours required to complete the work.
Estimated equipment usage cost.
Estimated parts/materials cost.
Estimated contractor or outside services cost.
Estimated miscellaneous costs not covered elsewhere.
Customer or internal client associated with the work.
Meter configuration used for scheduling; likely identifies the relevant meter or calculation method; confirm with SME.
Scheduling basis indicator specifying calendar-based versus meter-based triggering; confirm code mapping.
Estimated quantity related to the job (e.g., items or occurrences); confirm intended unit.
Record classification code for the template; controls behavior or reporting; confirm allowed values.
Reference key linking the template to attached files or documents.
Sum of all estimated costs for the work.
Indicates whether advanced scheduling or template features are enabled.
Asset subsystem identifier relevant to this maintenance.
Managing organization or operational unit accountable for the work.
Standard activity code categorizing the maintenance task.
Whether labor, equipment, and materials are shared across tasks within the resulting work order.
External vendor designated to perform or support the work.
Free-text description of the job site or asset location.
Street number portion of the site address.
Street name portion of the site address.
Nearest intersecting street for locating the site.
City of the job site.
State or province of the job site.
Postal code for the job site.
Geographic latitude of the site in decimal degrees.
Geographic longitude of the site in decimal degrees.
Elevation of the site; units may vary; confirm with SME.
Internal key referencing a standardized site address record.
Second address line for suite, building, or additional location details.
Internal location code indicating where the work applies or is managed.
Department responsible for work execution or cost ownership.
Indicates whether generated work orders include multiple tasks.
Optional configurable field for organization-specific use; confirm purpose with SME.
Standard failure/problem code associated with this maintenance template.
Narrative description of the failure or problem addressed.
Expected asset downtime associated with performing this work; confirm units.
Custom user-defined text field 3 for additional notes or data.
Identifier of the crew assigned to perform the work.
General notes or instructions associated with the template or resulting work orders.
Indicates whether the system auto-generates the asset/work description instead of manual entry.
User-defined text field 1 for supplemental information.
User-defined text field 2 for supplemental information.
Maintenance class flag distinguishing preventive versus corrective maintenance; used for planning and reporting.
